snippet: A new report says workers in the United States are falling behind their global peers in key measures, despite the fact that American employers pay a large wage premium for skilled labor.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column focuses on new Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development report saying workers in the United States are falling dangerously behind their global peers in key skills measures, despite the fact that American employers pay a large wage premium for skilled labor; points out it is problem for the economy with no short-term solution.
lead_paragraph: A new report says workers in the United States are falling behind their global peers in key measures, despite the fact that American employers pay a large wage premium for skilled labor.
